table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: The General-Head-Boundary Observation input file is used to specify observations of flow through
for use in the Observation process.

li.link: Hill, M.C., Banta, E.R., Harbaugh, A.W., and Anderman, E.R., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey modular ground-water model -- User guide to the Observation, Sensitivity, and Parameter-Estimation Processes and three post-processing programs: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-184, 210 p.

para.text: package package must be used in models in which the General-Head-Boundary Observation input file is used.
Input for the General-Head-Boundary Observation input file is read from a file that is specified with "GBOB" as the file type listed in the

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional and can include as many lines as desired. Each line needs to begin with the “#” character in the first column.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character string (maximum of 79 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character needs to be in column 1. Text is printed when the file is read and provides an opportunity for the user to include information about the model both in the input file and the associated output file.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQGB—is the number of cell groups for which general-head-boundary observations are listed. A group consists of the cells needed to represent one flow measurement (eq. 9).

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQCGB—is greater than or equal to the total number of cells in all cell groups. NQCGB must be greater than or equal to the sum of all |

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQTGB—is the total number of general-head-boundary observations for all cell groups. NQTGB must equal the sum of all
, which are specified in repetitions of item 3 in the input file.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IUGBOBSV—File unit for saving observation data in a file. Specify 0 for no observation output file. The file for this unit must be included as type “DATA” in the Name File.
—is an option keyword that turns off printing of input and output data in the Listing File.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MODFLOW-2005, MODFLOW-CFP, MODFLOW-NWT, MODFLOW-OWHM, and MODFLOW-LGR:

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: TOMULTGB—is the time-offset multiplier for general-head-boundary observations [-- or T/T]. The product of TOMULTGB and
must produce a time value in units consistent with other model input. TOMULTGB can be dimensionless or can be used to convert the units of
to the time unit used in the simulation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: EVFGB—is the error variance multiplier for observations represented by the General-Head Boundary Package and is used to calculate the weights as described below in the explanation of
. EVFGB makes it easy to change the weights uniformly for all flow observations represented using the General-Head Boundary Package.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IOWTQGB—is a flag that indicates that the variance-covariance matrix on general-head-boundary observations is to be read into array WTQ of item 7. If IOWTQGB equals zero, weights are calculated using
of item 4; if it is greater than zero, items 6 and 7 are read and used to calculate the weights.
Read items 3, 4, and 5 for each of
groups of cells for which general-head-boundary observations are to be specified.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQOBGB—is the number of times at which flows are observed for the group of cells.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQCLGB—is a flag, and the absolute value of NQCLGB is the number of cells in the group. If NQCLGB is less than zero,
= 1.0 for all cells in the group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: OBSNAM IREFSP TOFFSET HOBS STATISTIC STAT-FLAG PLOT-SYMBOL (free format)
MODFLOW-2005, MODFLOW-CFP, MODFLOW-NWT, MODFLOW-OWHM, and MODFLOW-LGR:
observation times for this group of cells.
STATISTIC and STAT-FLAG are ignored if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: OBSNAM—is a string of 1 to 12 nonblank characters used to identify the observation. The current version of MODFLOW-2000 (v 1.17.02) accepts duplicate observation names, but if duplicate names are found, a warning concerning the duplication is written to the Global file.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IREFSP—is the reference stress period to which the observation time is referenced. The reference point is the beginning of the stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: TOFFSET—is the time from the beginning of stress period IREFSP to the time of the observation [T]. TOFFSET must be in units such that the product of
and TOFFSET is in time units consistent with other model input. TOFFSET and
from the GBOB file and values of

from the Discretization file (Harbaugh and others, 2000) are used to determine the stress period, time step, and time during the time step for the observation. To specify that an observation is for a steady-state model solution, specify IREFSP as the stress-period number of the steady-state stress period, and specify TOFFSET such that the product
*TOFFSET is less than or equal to

is zero, set TOFFSET to zero. If the observation falls within a time step, the simulated equivalent is calculated by linearly interpolating between values for the beginning and end of the time step. If the first stress period is transient and the observation falls within the first time step, the simulated equivalent from the end of the time step is used because no flow from the beginning of the time step is available for interpolation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: HOBS—is the observed general-head-boundary gain (if HOBS is negative) or loss (if HOBS is positive) [L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: /T]. The terms “gain” and “loss” are from the perspective of the surface-water body, so that gains occur when water leaves the groundwater system, and losses occur when water flows into the groundwater system.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: FLWOBS—is the observed flow from the general-head boundary into the aquifer (positive) or the flow from the aquifer into the boundary (negative) [L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STATISTIC—is the value from which the weight for the observation is calculated as determined using STAT-FLAG. STATISTIC is ignored if
is greater than zero, in which case
of item 7 is used to define the weighting.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STAT-FLAG—is a flag identifying what STATISTIC is and how the weight is calculated.

li.text: STAT-FLAG = 0, STATISTIC is a scaled variance [(L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: STAT-FLAG = 1, STATISTIC is a scaled standard deviation [L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: STAT-FLAG = 2, STATISTIC is a scaled coefficient of variation [--], weight = 1/[(STATISTIC * HOBS)

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: PLOT-SYMBOL—is an integer that will be written to output files intended for graphical analysis to allow control of the symbols used when plotting data.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: LAYER—is the layer index of a general-head-boundary cell included in the cell group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ROW—is the row index of a general-head-boundary cell included in the cell group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: COLUMN—is the column index of a general-head-boundary cell included in the cell group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: FACTOR—is the portion of the simulated gain or loss in the cell that is included in the total simulated gain or loss for this cell group (f

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:sub; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: array containing the variance-covariance matrix on general-head-boundary flow observations [(L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: J, WTQ(I,J) is the covariance between observations I and J; if I = J, WTQ(I,J) is the variance of observation I. Note that the variance-covariance matrix is symmetric, but the entire matrix (upper and lower parts) must be entered.
